body.p: Accordingly, in November 2011 the IASB decided to consider making limited amendments to IFRS 9 with the following objectives:

li.p: consider the interaction between the classification and measurement of financial assets and the accounting for insurance contract liabilities;
address specific application questions raised by interested parties since IFRS 9 was issued; and
seek to reduce key differences with the FASB’s tentative classification and measurement model for financial instruments.
